definition: memory (ability to retain information)
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]
the palest ink is better than the best memory (idiom)
pinyin: hao3 ji4 xing4 bu4 ru2 lan4 bi3 tou2

definition: (coll.) to learn one's lesson/to have enough brains to learn from one's mistakes

sentences.english: If your memory is poor, develop a system.
sentences.chinese: 如果記性差，就想出一套辦法來。

sentences.english: The critic was born with a good memory.
sentences.chinese: 那個評論家生來就記性好。

sentences.english: Memory affects intelligence and good memory raises the effective IQ.
sentences.chinese: 記憶影響着智力，好記性能夠有效提升IQ。

sentences.english: Hope has a good memory, gratitude a bad one.
sentences.chinese: 希望有一個好記性，感激則有壞記性。

sentences.english: Hope has a good memory, gratitude a bad one.
sentences.chinese: 希望有一個好記性，感激則有壞記性。

sentences.english: Unless they have a very, very good memory, they will not.
sentences.chinese: 除非他們記性非常好，否則他們答不出來。

sentences.english: I once knew a man whose memory was very bad.
sentences.chinese: 有一次我認識一個人他的記性非常的差。

sentences.english: If I had a good memory, I wouldn't forget people's names all the time.
sentences.chinese: 如果我有個好記性，我就不會老是忘記人們的名字了。

sentences.english: Well, I would never have no memory even I never read the story about wolf is coming.
sentences.chinese: 就算我沒讀過狼來了的故事，我也不會再不長記性了。

sentences.english: I have a memory like a sieve , so I have to note down everything I heard.
sentences.chinese: 我的記性很壞，聽到什麼東西就非用筆記下來不可。

sentences.english: The lender has a better memory than the borrower.
My son has a good memory, so he does well in school.
sentences.chinese: 我兒子記性很好，所以他在學校表現優良。

sentences.english: To depend on your memory without studying for a test is to grasp at straws.
sentences.chinese: 應付考試光靠好記性而不用功是枉費心機。

sentences.english: Has been used to my memory difference, had said the words always forgot.
sentences.chinese: 習慣了我的記性差，說過的話老忘記。

sentences.english: Most people confess to a bad memory.
sentences.chinese: 大多數人都承認記性差。

sentences.english: Many complain of their Memory, few of their judgment.
sentences.chinese: 許多人抱怨自己記性不佳，幾乎沒人說自己判斷力差。

definition: (longstanding) opponent/enemy/inimical/adversary/opponent
correct/normal/to be on good terms with/on the right track/right
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
character/temperament/disposition/bad temper/CL:個|个[ge4]
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
fortunately/luckily
(coll.) serve sb right/deservedly/ought/should
clumsy/all thumbs
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
(coll.) to go crazy/to lose it/demented/unhinged
slow in one's reactions/sluggish (in movement or thought)
to be an irksome presence (i.e. sth or sb one wishes were not there)
ugly/unsightly
to anger/to annoy
way/method/means/Taiwan pr. [fa1 r5]
